blackjack

Class Dealer

  • java.lang.Object
    • blackjack.Dealer

  • public class Dealer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class has associated three classes. The Hand of the dealer, Shoe containing all the cards to deliver dealer and player, and Junk to store all used cards.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Pedro Esteves, Ricardo Cristino, Rui Bras

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Hand hand
      The hand.
      private Junk junk
      The junk.
      private Shoe shoe
      The shoe.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Dealer(Shoe d, Junk j)
      The constructor receives as inputs the Shoe and Junk to associate and creates a new empty Hand.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canHaveBlackjack()
      Verifies if dealer's shown card is an Ace, returns true if it is and false if it's not.
      void cleanDealerHand()
      Adds the cards from dealer's hand to the junk, and then empties the elements from his hand.
      void cleanPlayerHands(Player p)
      Receives as input a Player, than removes all hands and bets of an index greater than 0 from the respective lists hands and bet, and leaves the first hand of the list.
      protected Card dealCard()
      Accesses shoe and takes a card from the beginning of the LinkedList.
      void drawCardToDealer()
      Adds a new card to the hand of the dealer, this card is took from the shoe.
      void drawFirstFour(Player p)
      Distributes the first four cards of the game, the first two are dealt to the dealer and the next two to the player.
      Hand getDealerHand()
      Returns dealer's hand.
      void printDealersFirstTwo()
      Prints in the terminal the initial hand of the dealer, hiding the hole card with X.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string in the format "dealer's hand: " + hand.toString().

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getDealerHand

        public Hand getDealerHand()
        Returns dealer's hand.
        Returns:
        the dealer hand

      • canHaveBlackjack

        public boolean canHaveBlackjack()
        Verifies if dealer's shown card is an Ace, returns true if it is and false if it's not.
        Returns:
        true, if successful

      • printDealersFirstTwo

        public void printDealersFirstTwo()
        Prints in the terminal the initial hand of the dealer, hiding the hole card with X.

      • dealCard

        protected Card dealCard()
        Accesses shoe and takes a card from the beginning of the LinkedList. If the shoe is empty the junk is added back to the deck and re-shuffled. After this, a card from the beginning of the LinkedList is returned.
        Returns:
        the card

      • drawCardToDealer

        public void drawCardToDealer()
        Adds a new card to the hand of the dealer, this card is took from the shoe.

      • drawFirstFour

        public void drawFirstFour(Player p)
        Distributes the first four cards of the game, the first two are dealt to the dealer and the next two to the player. It must receive a Player as input.
        Parameters:
        p - the p

      • cleanDealerHand

        public void cleanDealerHand()
        Adds the cards from dealer's hand to the junk, and then empties the elements from his hand.

      • cleanPlayerHands

        public void cleanPlayerHands(Player p)
        Receives as input a Player, than removes all hands and bets of an index greater than 0 from the respective lists hands and bet, and leaves the first hand of the list. The cards from the hands are added to the junk and bet from the first index is set to 0.
        Parameters:
        p - the p

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string in the format "dealer's hand: " + hand.toString().
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the string
